snippet: Violence against the Rohingya minority has presented a test for Myanmar’s leaders, who have done little to rein in the ethnic killings even as they pursue broad political and economic reforms.
abstract: Ethnic violence in Myanmar against the Rohingya minority presents test for country's leaders, who have done little to rein in killings even as they pursue broad political and economic reforms; villagers confirm United Nations investigation finding that attack on village Du Chee Yar Tan was one among worst instances of violence against the country's Muslim minority.
lead_paragraph: Violence against the Rohingya minority has presented a test for Myanmar’s leaders, who have done little to rein in the ethnic killings even as they pursue broad political and economic reforms.

headline.main: Rise in Bigotry Fuels Massacre Inside Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Rise in Bigotry Fuels Massacre Inside Myanmar

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
